The only thing that keeps stopping me from cycling is the constant shopping for the â€œperfectâ€ bike. Getting an entry level road bike is a waste of money IMO. THE ONLY PART CONFUSING in this video is the girl saying that some days she hates her bike. I ride a lot too, but I don't recall a day I hate my bike. I recall a moment I hated my bike, it was 120 miles into a 9k feet climbing day, at hour 7:00:00, I started to wonder why I was putting myself through it... then 2 days later (and after taking one day off) I was in the best shape of my life. 2 months later I was winning a race (even though I am usually one of the fast guys around, I am not much of a racer. I cant stand the dumb dudes throwing their bikes on you). I am not of a Rapha kind of rider. I like to ride for the love and pleasure of it. I like to see things, I don't mind taking pulls to pull the lazy guys that never want to pull, they like to save it for that final popular stretch, but still, even after pulling them to the sprint, I will still beat all of them if not most of them... Cycling has changed my life and health, for better
